cards.name: Abyssal Horror
cards.text:
Flying
When Abyssal Horror enters the battlefield, target player discards two cards.
cards.flavor:
"I dreamt of it once. Now I fear it dreams of me."
—Tolarian scholar

cards.name: Abyssal Specter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Abyssal Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.
cards.flavor: To gaze under its hood is to invite death.

cards.name: Adarkar Wastes
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool. Adarkar Wastes deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Æther Flash
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, Æther Flash deals 2 damage to it.
cards.flavor: As the foul beast appeared, arcane lightning crackled around it.

cards.name: Agonizing Memories
cards.text: Look at target player's hand and choose two cards from it. Put them on top of that player's library in any order.
cards.flavor:
"I think little of the foes I've slain. But I'm haunted by the friends I've sent to die."
—The Southern Paladin

cards.name: Air Elemental
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Where psycho meets cyclone.

cards.name: Aladdin's Ring
cards.text: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: Some say Aladdin's third wish was for this ring.

cards.name: Anaconda
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: You'll never find an anaconda in a swamp. It will always find you first.

cards.name: Ancestral Memories
cards.text: Look at the top seven cards of your library. Put two of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"It's a poor sort of memory that only works backwards."
—Lewis Carroll,
Through the Looking Glass

cards.name: Ancient Silverback
cards.text: {G}: Regenerate Ancient Silverback. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor: The Phyrexian killing machines couldn't have known the seriousness of their mistake in wounding the ape—they'd never seen it angry.

cards.name: Angelic Page
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: If only every message were as perfect as its messenger.

cards.name: Arcane Laboratory
cards.text: Each player can't cast more than one spell each turn.
cards.flavor:
Too many wizards spoil the spell, but too many spells spoil the wizard.
—Sign on entry to arcane lab

cards.name: Archivist
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Knowledge is a feast for the mind. Savor every swallow."

cards.name: Ardent Militia
cards.text: Vigilance
cards.flavor: Knights fight for honor and mercenaries fight for gold. The militia fights for hearth and home.

cards.name: Balduvian Barbarians
cards.flavor:
"From the snowy slopes of Kaelor,
To the canyons of Bandu,
We drink and fight and feast and die
As we were born to do."
—Balduvian tavern song

cards.name: Baleful Stare
cards.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You draw a card for each Mountain and red card in it.
cards.flavor: He can drown you in his eyes.

cards.name: Beast of Burden
cards.text: Beast of Burden's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: The heavier the load, the harder it works.

cards.name: Bedlam
cards.text: Creatures can't block.
cards.flavor: The generals were dead. The battle plans were forgotten. It was everyone for themselves.

cards.name: Befoul
cards.text: Destroy target land or nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: The bog's touch means death to all but the darkest of hearts.

cards.name: Bellowing Fiend
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Bellowing Fiend deals damage to a creature, Bellowing Fiend deals 3 damage to that creature's controller and 3 damage to you.

cards.name: Benthic Behemoth
cards.text: Islandwalk
cards.flavor: The sea has many secrets, but some are too big to be kept.

cards.name: Bereavement
cards.text: Whenever a green creature dies, its controller discards a card.
cards.flavor: Grief is a razor that slices the soul.

cards.name: Birds of Paradise
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Blanchwood Armor
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Forest you control.
cards.flavor:
"There's never been a dwarven smith who could match the marvels that Gaea herself forges."
—The Elvish Champion

cards.name: Blaze
cards.text: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: Fire never dies alone.

cards.name: Blessed Reversal
cards.text: You gain 3 life for each creature attacking you.
cards.flavor:
"A battle's outcome is never certain."
—The Southern Paladin

cards.name: Blood Pet
cards.text: Sacrifice Blood Pet: Add {B} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: No thrull has ever been burdened with a long life.

cards.name: Bloodshot Cyclops
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Bloodshot Cyclops deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: After their first encounter, the goblins named him Chuck.

cards.name: Bog Imp
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Think of it as a butcher knife with wings.

cards.name: Bog Wraith
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: The bodies of its victims are the only tracks it leaves.

cards.name: Boil
cards.text: Destroy all Islands.
cards.flavor:
"It is a slaughter, the death of a sea. Never speak of it again."
—The Lord of Atlantis

cards.name: Boomerang
cards.text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Returne from whence ye came. . . ."
—Edmund Spenser,
The Faerie Queene

cards.name: Breath of Life
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"Nothing can stop the power of life—not even death."
—Onean cleric

cards.name: Brushland
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool. Brushland deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Bull Hippo
cards.text: Islandwalk
cards.flavor: The merfolk may rule the waters, but hippos have never had much respect for authority.

cards.name: Caltrops
cards.text: Whenever a creature attacks, Caltrops deals 1 damage to it.
cards.flavor: The Eastern Paladin knew how highly his southern rival valued horses, so he gleefully prepared a suitable welcome.

cards.name: Canopy Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: It keeps the upper reaches of the forest free of every menace . . . except for the spider itself.

cards.name: Castle
cards.text: Untapped creatures you control get +0/+2.
cards.flavor:
". . . Our castle's strength
Will laugh a siege to scorn."
—William Shakespeare,
Macbeth

cards.name: Charcoal Diamond
cards.text:
Charcoal Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Black
cards.text: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Blue
cards.text: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Green
cards.text: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Red
cards.text: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: White
cards.text: {1}: The next time a white source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: City of Brass
cards.text:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Cloudchaser Eagle
cards.text:
Flying
When Cloudchaser Eagle enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.
cards.flavor: Most eagles hunt small animals. The cloudchasers hunt magic.

cards.name: Coat of Arms
cards.text: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)

cards.name: Compost
cards.text: Whenever a black card is put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor:
A fruit must rot before its seed can sprout.
—Yavimaya saying

cards.name: Confiscate
cards.text:
Enchant permanent (Target a permanent as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that permanent.)
You control enchanted permanent.
cards.flavor:
"The surface world contains nothing I cannot take."
—The Lord of Atlantis

cards.name: Coral Merfolk
cards.flavor: The coral merfolk delight in wrestling with their foes, skinning them alive on the razor-sharp edges of their reef.

cards.name: Corrupt
cards.text: Corrupt deals damage equal to the number of Swamps you control to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Creeping Mold
cards.text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.
cards.flavor: Mold crept over the walls and into every crevice until the gleaming white stone strained and burst.

cards.name: Crimson Hellkite
cards.text:
Flying
{X}, {T}: Crimson Hellkite deals X damage to target creature. Spend only red mana this way.
cards.flavor: The hellkites are artists with flames, painting the world with fire.

cards.name: Crossbow Infantry
cards.text: {T}: Crossbow Infantry deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor: Twang. You're dead.

cards.name: Crypt Rats
cards.text: {X}: Crypt Rats deals X damage to each creature and each player. Spend only black mana this way.
cards.flavor:
Beware anything born among the dead.
—Tolarian saying

cards.name: Crystal Rod
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Polished by a thousand waves.

cards.name: Dakmor Lancer
cards.text: When Dakmor Lancer enters the battlefield, destroy target nonblack creature.
cards.flavor: The darkness of his shield reflects the inky blackness of his soul.

cards.name: Daring Apprentice
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Daring Apprentice: Counter target spell.
cards.flavor: "I've seen my master do this a hundred times. How hard can it be?"

cards.name: Dark Banishing
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"Hence ‘banishèd' is banished from the world, / And the world's exile is death."
—William Shakespeare,
Romeo and Juliet

cards.name: Darkest Hour
cards.text: All creatures are black.
cards.flavor: The eclipse made it clear whose side the sky was on.

cards.name: Deflection
cards.text: Change the target of target spell with a single target.
cards.flavor:
"You've thrown your net at the wrong fish."
—The Lord of Atlantis

cards.name: Delusions of Mediocrity
cards.text:
When Delusions of Mediocrity enters the battlefield, you gain 10 life.
When Delusions of Mediocrity leaves the battlefield, you lose 10 life.
cards.flavor: When nothing but second best will do.

cards.name: Dingus Egg
cards.text: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
cards.flavor: Legend has it that the world was hatched from a dingus egg.

cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Disorder
cards.text: Disorder deals 2 damage to each white creature and each player who controls a white creature.
cards.flavor:
"Fire hurts them almost as much as the chaos that follows. Almost."
—The Western Paladin

cards.name: Disrupting Scepter
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.

cards.name: Dregs of Sorrow
cards.text: Destroy X target nonblack creatures. Draw X cards.
cards.flavor:
"We live for a thousand years. The death of even one brings untold sorrow."
—Elvish elder

cards.name: Drudge Skeletons
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, they never surrender, and they don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral,
Necromancer's Handbook

cards.name: Duress
cards.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor: "Change your mind, or I'll change it for you."

cards.name: Eager Cadet
cards.flavor: "Training? Seeing my crops burnt to cinders was all the ‘training' I needed."

cards.name: Early Harvest
cards.text: Target player untaps all basic lands he or she controls.
cards.flavor: "Give it a week and it will feed an army."

cards.name: Earthquake
cards.text: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

cards.name: Eastern Paladin
cards.text: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target green creature.
cards.flavor:
"There is no worse enemy. His passion for death doesn't just border on insanity, it wallows in it."
—The Southern Paladin

cards.name: Elder Druid
cards.text: {3}{G}, {T}: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
cards.flavor: "I may seem wise to you, but I'm merely a sapling among mighty oaks."

cards.name: Elite Archers
cards.text: {T}: Elite Archers deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor: They fletch their arrows with the feathers of angels.

cards.name: Elvish Archers
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor: The archers have a reputation for attacking without warning. They claim that the first arrow is the warning.

cards.name: Elvish Champion
cards.text: Other Elf creatures get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor:
"For what are leaves but countless blades
To fight a countless foe on high."
—Elvish hymn

cards.name: Elvish Lyrist
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Lyrist: Destroy target enchantment.
cards.flavor: To an elf, magic and music are the same.

cards.name: Elvish Piper
cards.text: {G}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
From Gaea grew the world, and the world was silent. From Gaea grew the world's elves, and the world was silent no more.
—Elvish teaching

cards.name: Engineered Plague
cards.text:
As Engineered Plague enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
All creatures of the chosen type get -1/-1.
cards.flavor: A single germ can kill more soldiers than ten thousand blades.

cards.name: Ensnaring Bridge
cards.text: Creatures with power greater than the number of cards in your hand can't attack.
cards.flavor: Bridges usually get you from one place to another. This one just gets you.

cards.name: Equilibrium
cards.text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
Seek balance in all things—as long as the scales are weighted in your favor.
—Vodalian saying

cards.name: Evacuation
cards.text: Return all creatures to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor:
"How many people can you save in that thing?"
"All of them," replied the mage with a smile.

cards.name: Fallen Angel
cards.text:
Flying
Sacrifice a creature: Fallen Angel gets +2/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Why do you weep for the dead? I rejoice, for they have died for me."
—Fallen angel, to Serra

cards.name: Familiar Ground
cards.text: Each creature you control can't be blocked by more than one creature.
cards.flavor: More than any other battlefield, the forest gives the advantage to those who know it best.

cards.name: Fear
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor: "Booga booga booga"

cards.name: Femeref Archers
cards.text: {T}: Femeref Archers deals 4 damage to target attacking creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"Bet you can't put it through the eye."
"Left or right?"

cards.name: Feroz's Ban
cards.text: Creature spells cost {2} more to cast.
cards.flavor: Feroz is gone, but what remains is his final gift to his people: the right to be left alone.

cards.name: Fervor
cards.text: Creatures you control have haste. (They can attack and {T} as soon as they come under your control.)
cards.flavor: The intensity of their glare was soon surpassed by the intensity of their attack.

cards.name: Fighting Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Scholars in their ivory towers call them "sharks of the sky." Scholars on the road don't call them at all.

cards.name: Final Fortune
cards.text: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.
cards.flavor: A reward is worthless if you aren't around to enjoy it.

cards.name: Fire Diamond
cards.text:
Fire Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Fire Elemental
cards.flavor: It treads on feet of coals and strikes with the force of a volcano.

cards.name: Fleeting Image
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{1}{U}: Return Fleeting Image to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"It was as if we fought a shadow."
—Onean soldier

cards.name: Flight
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.

cards.name: Flying Carpet
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Wheeeeeeeeeeeeeee"

cards.name: Fog
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.name: Force Spike
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
cards.flavor: "I don't think so."

cards.name: Foul Imp
cards.text:
Flying
When Foul Imp enters the battlefield, you lose 2 life.
cards.flavor: The villagers call it "winged stench."

cards.name: Fugue
cards.text: Target player discards three cards.
cards.flavor:
"It's hard to keep our own troops from fleeing when he's like this. How can our foes possibly stand against him?"
—Field marshal for the Eastern Paladin

cards.name: Fyndhorn Elder
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: "It is useful to be able to speak to the trees. But it is truly wondrous to be able to listen to them."

cards.name: Gang of Elk
cards.text: Whenever Gang of Elk becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
cards.flavor:
"I felt the ground shake, so I hid in my tent until the earthquake passed. It passed all right, and it left hoofprints."
—Femeref explorer

cards.name: Gerrard's Wisdom
cards.text: You gain 2 life for each card in your hand.
cards.flavor: A picture is worth a thousand swords.

cards.name: Ghitu Fire-Eater
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Ghitu Fire-Eater: Ghitu Fire-Eater deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: The Ghitu believe their race was born of fire, and it's an honor to return to it.

cards.name: Giant Cockroach
cards.flavor: Toren had stepped on a lot of bugs during his life, so he couldn't help feeling embarrassed when a bug stepped on him.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Giant Octopus
cards.flavor: The only thing that flows faster than water is fear.

cards.name: Giant Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:
Watching the spider's web
—Llanowar expression meaning
"focusing on the wrong thing"

cards.name: Glacial Wall
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
cards.flavor:
Like arguing with ice
—Vodalian expression meaning
"wasting your time"

cards.name: Glorious Anthem
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1.
cards.flavor:
"North and South meet and angels sing.
Voices resound with a righteous ring."
—"The Ballad of the Paladins"

cards.name: Goblin Chariot
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: The hardest part of his training is learning not to eat the boar.

cards.name: Goblin Digging Team
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team: Destroy target Wall.
cards.flavor:
"Dig. Dig. Dig. Dig. Dig. Dig. Die"
—Goblin chant

cards.name: Goblin Elite Infantry
cards.text: Whenever Goblin Elite Infantry blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
We're elite. You're not.
—Infantry motto

cards.name: Goblin Gardener
cards.text: When Goblin Gardener dies, destroy target land.
cards.flavor: Years of attempts have brought the goblins no closer to growing a sausage tree.

cards.name: Goblin Glider
cards.text:
Flying
Goblin Glider can't block.
cards.flavor:
"What's got two arms, one wing, and no brains?"
—Ghitu riddle

cards.name: Goblin King
cards.text: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor: To be king, Numsgil did in Blog, who did in Unkful, who did in Viddle, who did in Loll, who did in Alrok. . . .

cards.name: Goblin Matron
cards.text: When Goblin Matron enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Goblin Raider
cards.text: Goblin Raider can't block.
cards.flavor: He's smart for a goblin. He can do two things: hit and run.

cards.name: Goblin Spelunkers
cards.text: Mountainwalk
cards.flavor: Goblins prefer caves to just about anything else. Caves prefer just about anything else to goblins.

cards.name: Goblin War Drums
cards.text: Each creature you control can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
cards.flavor: The goblin idea of music is to hit something with a stick.

cards.name: Gorilla Chieftain
cards.text: {1}{G}: Regenerate Gorilla Chieftain.
cards.flavor: A gorilla chief must always be prepared to defend his crown. This leads to some pretty tough apes.

cards.name: Grafted Skullcap
cards.text:
At the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card.
At the beginning of your end step, discard your hand.
cards.flavor: "Every day, I fight for my life and win. Every night, I fight to remember my name and lose."

cards.name: Granite Grip
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 for each Mountain you control.
cards.flavor: "Let me introduce you to Rocky."

cards.name: Grapeshot Catapult
cards.text: {T}: Grapeshot Catapult deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
cards.flavor: The Southern Paladin taught the airborne vermin to fear the storm that rains upward.

cards.name: Gravedigger
cards.text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.

cards.name: Greed
cards.text: {B}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: An advisor once asked the Western Paladin how much gold would be enough. "I have no need of fools who can imagine ‘enough,'" he told the advisor's corpse.

cards.name: Grizzly Bears
cards.flavor: They've got claws as long as your arm. And they're grouchy. Really, really grouchy.

cards.name: Healing Salve
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains 3 life.
• Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Heavy Ballista
cards.text: {T}: Heavy Ballista deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor:
"Soldiers wear down and enemies collapse—but the ballista never tires."
—Ballista captain

cards.name: Hibernation
cards.text: Return all green permanents to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor: The deep sleep of winter is not always restful.

cards.name: Hill Giant
cards.flavor: Hill giants are mostly just big. Of course, that does count for a lot.

cards.name: Hollow Dogs
cards.text: Whenever Hollow Dogs attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A hollow dog is never empty. It is filled with thirst for the hunt.

cards.name: Holy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.

cards.name: Honor Guard
cards.text: {W}: Honor Guard gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The strength of one. The courage of ten.

cards.name: Horned Turtle
cards.flavor: It doesn't like having visitors . . . unless it's having them for lunch.

cards.name: Howl from Beyond
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Whether it howls for hunger or for joy, you're in trouble just the same.

cards.name: Howling Mine
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.
cards.flavor: Legend has it that the mine howls out the last words of those who died inside.

cards.name: Hurricane
cards.text: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.

cards.name: Impatience
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's end step, if that player didn't cast a spell this turn, Impatience deals 2 damage to him or her.
cards.flavor: "I'm going to count to three. Three."

cards.name: Infernal Contract
cards.text: Draw four cards. You lose half your life, rounded up.
cards.flavor:
"East and West meet and angels cry.
Unholy power darkens the sky."
—"The Ballad of the Paladins"

cards.name: Inferno
cards.text: Inferno deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor:
"Some have said there is no subtlety to destruction. You know what? They're dead."
—Wandering mage

cards.name: Inspiration
cards.text: Target player draws two cards.

cards.name: Intrepid Hero
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater.
cards.flavor: A fool knows no fear. A hero shows no fear.

cards.name: Iron Star
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Forged by a thousand flames.

cards.name: Ivory Cup
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Blessed by a thousand prayers.

cards.name: Jalum Tome
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: Most books simply deliver knowledge. This one expects some in return.

cards.name: Jandor's Saddlebags
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Untap target creature.
cards.flavor:
Your heart's desire is found within.
—Saddlebag inscription

cards.name: Jayemdae Tome
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Knowledge is power."
—Sir Francis Bacon,
Meditationes Sacrae

cards.name: Karplusan Forest
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool. Karplusan Forest deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Kjeldoran Royal Guard
cards.text: {T}: All combat damage that would be dealt to you by unblocked creatures this turn is dealt to Kjeldoran Royal Guard instead.
cards.flavor:
Honorable in battle, generous in death.
—Motto of the Kjeldoran Royal Guard

cards.name: Knight Errant
cards.flavor: Knights are quick to pledge their loyalty and even quicker to charge into battle.

cards.name: Knighthood
cards.text: Creatures you control have first strike.
cards.flavor: Kings don't make knights. Actions do.

cards.name: Lava Axe
cards.text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.
cards.flavor: "Catch"

cards.name: Leshrac's Rite
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has swampwalk.
cards.flavor:
"Brackish water, dark and blind
Heed my will, to you I bind."
—Opening passage of Leshrac's Rite

cards.name: Levitation
cards.text: Creatures you control have flying.
cards.flavor: "We'll be easy targets if we remain on the ground. Let's take the fight to them."

cards.name: Lightning Blast
cards.text: Lightning Blast deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor:
"I'll climb down soon. Don't worry, it's just a thundersto—"
—Former elvish scout

cards.name: Lightning Elemental
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor:
"A flash of the lightning, a break of the wave,
He passes from life to his rest in the grave."
—William Knox, "Mortality"

cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: Llanowar covers a million square miles, yet nobody enters the forest without the elves knowing it.

cards.name: Lone Wolf
cards.text: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
cards.flavor: A wolf without a pack is either a survivor or a brute.

cards.name: Longbow Archer
cards.text: First strike; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: Some say they have the blood of hawks running through their veins.

cards.name: Looming Shade
cards.text: {B}: Looming Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: On darkness feeding, in nightmares breeding.

cards.name: Lord of Atlantis
cards.text: Other Merfolk creatures get +1/+1 and have islandwalk.
cards.flavor: A master of tactics, the Lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.

cards.name: Lure
cards.text:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
cards.flavor:
"When the forest wants something, no mortal mind can resist her."
—Maro

cards.name: Mahamoti Djinn
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

cards.name: Mana Breach
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player returns a land he or she controls to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: The mana that binds the world together can also tear it apart.

cards.name: Mana Clash
cards.text: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.

cards.name: Mana Short
cards.text: Tap all lands target player controls and empty his or her mana pool.
cards.flavor:
"Remove their power, and their will to fight will follow."
—Tolarian wizard

cards.name: Marble Diamond
cards.text:
Marble Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Maro
cards.text: Maro's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
cards.flavor: No two see the same Maro.

cards.name: Master Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
cards.flavor: Her heart holds the pain of every soldier she's ever healed.

cards.name: Mawcor
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Mawcor deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: Neither head holds a brain—that's located somewhere in the chest—but four eyes aim much better than two.

cards.name: Meekstone
cards.text: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
cards.flavor: The bigger they are, the stronger its pull.

cards.name: Megrim
cards.text: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.
cards.flavor: Memories cut from the mind can cut right back.

cards.name: Memory Lapse
cards.text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.
cards.flavor: "Eri phar phesta . . . um, phistor . . . er, phistara . . ."

cards.name: Merfolk Looter
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: When you sink a lot of ships, it's easy to find sunken treasure.

cards.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
cards.flavor:
"The paladins would be wise not to forget about the Pearl Trident. The merfolk warriors have turned the tide of more than one human war . . . and I have no doubt they shall do so again."
—Onean scholar

cards.name: Might of Oaks
cards.text: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Guess where I'm gonna plant this"

cards.name: Millstone
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
cards.flavor: More than one mage has been driven insane by the sound of the millstone relentlessly grinding away.

cards.name: Mind Rot
cards.text: Target player discards two cards.
cards.flavor: What wizards fear most is losing their minds.

cards.name: Monstrous Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Get in touch with your inner monster.

cards.name: Moss Diamond
cards.text:
Moss Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Nature's Resurgence
cards.text: Each player draws a card for each creature card in his or her graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"The dead whisper to the living. If you listen, you will learn."
—Maro

cards.name: Nature's Revolt
cards.text: All lands are 2/2 creatures that are still lands.
cards.flavor: The land rises up to defend against those who would spoil its beauty.

cards.name: Nausea
cards.text: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: No fear. No sense. And soon, no lunch.

cards.name: Necrologia
cards.text:
Cast Necrologia only during your end step.
As an additional cost to cast Necrologia, pay X life.
Draw X cards.

cards.name: Nightmare
cards.text:
Flying
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
cards.flavor: The thunder of its hooves beats dreams into despair.

cards.name: Nocturnal Raid
cards.text: Black creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The Eastern Paladin doesn't attack at night for the tactical advantage. He does it for the sheer joy of fighting beneath the moon.

cards.name: Northern Paladin
cards.text: {W}{W}, {T}: Destroy target black permanent.
cards.flavor:
"How smooth his face, how sure his thoughts. I look forward to breaking his mighty will."
—The Eastern Paladin

cards.name: Ogre Taskmaster
cards.text: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.
cards.flavor: Ogres learn how to smash stuff even before they learn how to walk.

cards.name: Okk
cards.text:
Okk can't attack unless a creature with greater power also attacks.
Okk can't block unless a creature with greater power also blocks.

cards.name: Opportunity
cards.text: Target player draws four cards.
cards.flavor:
Little things like morals shouldn't hinder one's ambition.
—Pirate creed

cards.name: Opposition
cards.text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
cards.flavor: Exhausting a wizard can be exhausting work.

cards.name: Oppression
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player discards a card.
cards.flavor:
"Defeating an enemy is not nearly as satisfying as watching one suffer."
—The Western Paladin

cards.name: Orcish Artillery
cards.text: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.
cards.flavor:
"Ready . . . aim . . . fire"
"Ow"

cards.name: Orcish Oriflamme
cards.text: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.

cards.name: Ostracize
cards.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a creature card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor: "You won't be needing this."

cards.name: Pacifism
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
cards.flavor: Without warriors there can be no war.

cards.name: Pariah
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
All damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to enchanted creature instead.
cards.flavor: A valiant knight's life has no meaning without honor.

cards.name: Patagia Golem
cards.text: {3}: Patagia Golem gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Its wings were only designed to be ornamental, but it learned to use them on its own.

cards.name: Persecute
cards.text: Choose a color. Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards of that color.
cards.flavor: "I want every last one of these tree-hugging, earth-loving, pointy-eared weaklings out of here. Now"

cards.name: Phantom Warrior
cards.text: Phantom Warrior can't be blocked.
cards.flavor: It can pass through solid matter—but that doesn't mean it's harmless.

cards.name: Phyrexian Colossus
cards.text:
Phyrexian Colossus doesn't untap during your untap step.
Pay 8 life: Untap Phyrexian Colossus.
Phyrexian Colossus can't be blocked except by three or more creatures.

cards.name: Phyrexian Hulk
cards.flavor:
It doesn't think. It doesn't feel.
It doesn't laugh or cry.
All it does from dusk till dawn
Is make the soldiers die.
—Onean children's rhyme

cards.name: Pillage
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or land. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"Burn their homes. Salt their lands. Nothing survives."
—The Western Paladin

cards.name: Pit Trap
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Pit Trap: Destroy target attacking creature without flying. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
Never forget your feet
—Elvish expression meaning
"watch your step"

cards.name: Plague Beetle
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: No one knows whether they were named for the diseases they carry or for the speed at which they multiply.

cards.name: Pride of Lions
cards.text: You may have Pride of Lions assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
cards.flavor: There's only one thing worse than a hungry lion—many hungry lions.

cards.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
cards.text: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: He wastes his amazing talents on proving how amazing he really is.

cards.name: Purify
cards.text: Destroy all artifacts and enchantments.
cards.flavor:
"We have no need for these trinkets. We need only the strength of our swords and the virtue of our hearts."
—The Northern Paladin

cards.name: Pygmy Pyrosaur
cards.text:
Pygmy Pyrosaur can't block.
{R}: Pygmy Pyrosaur gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
Do not judge a lizard by its size.
—Ghitu proverb

cards.name: Pyroclasm
cards.text: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.
cards.flavor:
"When the air burns, only death breathes deep."
—Bogardan mage

cards.name: Pyrotechnics
cards.text: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
cards.flavor:
"Who says lightning never strikes twice?"
—Storm shaman

cards.name: Rag Man
cards.text: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Target opponent reveals his or her hand and discards a creature card at random. Activate this ability only during your turn.
cards.flavor: He hunts what might have been.

cards.name: Raging Goblin
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.

cards.name: Raise Dead
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.

cards.name: Rampant Growth
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Nature grows solutions to her problems.

cards.name: Razorfoot Griffin
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor: Like a meteor, it strikes from above without warning. Unlike a meteor, it then carries you off and eats you.

cards.name: Razortooth Rats
cards.text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor: They'll chew through armor, flesh, and bone. They'll even chew through each other if they're hungry enough.

cards.name: Reckless Embermage
cards.text: {1}{R}: Reckless Embermage deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to itself.
cards.flavor: Those who play with fire are bound to get burned.

cards.name: Reclaim
cards.text: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.
cards.flavor: The wise pay as much attention to what they throw away as to what they keep.

cards.name: Redwood Treefolk
cards.flavor:
And would you strip the bark from a treefolk?
—Elvish expression meaning
"Are you crazy?"

cards.name: Reflexes
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor:
"Be as fast as lightning, and you will be just as deadly."
—Combat trainer

cards.name: Regeneration
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor:
"Why should death always have the last word?"
—Llanowar druid

cards.name: Relentless Assault
cards.text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
cards.flavor: "Mercy? Mercy is for the playground, not the battleground."

cards.name: Remove Soul
cards.text: Counter target creature spell.

cards.name: Reprisal
cards.text: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: "Fear this no more"

cards.name: Reprocess
cards.text: Sacrifice any number of artifacts, creatures, and/or lands. Draw a card for each permanent sacrificed this way.
cards.flavor: The battle's end is the meal's beginning.

cards.name: Revenant
cards.text:
Flying
Revenant's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: It eats death and drinks pain.

cards.name: Reverse Damage
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.
cards.flavor: "Weapons usually bring death. Today, mine will bring life."

cards.name: Rod of Ruin
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: The rod is a relic from ancient times . . . cruel, vicious, mean-spirited times.

cards.name: Rolling Stones
cards.text: Wall creatures can attack as though they didn't have defender.
cards.flavor:
"We spent three weeks trying to knock that wall down. Now it's knocking us down."
—Onean sergeant

cards.name: Rowen
cards.text: Reveal the first card you draw each turn. Whenever you reveal a basic land card this way, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Those who understand the forest are free to harvest its bounty.

cards.name: Sabretooth Tiger
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor: "Here, kitty kitty. Here, kitty kitty. Aaaaugh"

cards.name: Sacred Ground
cards.text: Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls causes a land to be put into your graveyard from the battlefield, return that card to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: The land will never betray those who gave their lives for it.

cards.name: Sacred Nectar
cards.text: You gain 4 life.
cards.flavor:
"For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge,
"Kubla Khan"

cards.name: Sage Owl
cards.text:
Flying
When Sage Owl enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

cards.name: Samite Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
cards.flavor: Why does a Samite heal? You might as well ask why a bird flies.

cards.name: Sanctimony
cards.text: Whenever an opponent taps a Mountain for mana, you may gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: "The peasants labor for my profit. I approve."

cards.name: Scathe Zombies
cards.flavor:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,
Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;
It had been strange, even in a dream,
To have seen those dead men rise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge,
"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

cards.name: Scavenger Folk
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Scavenger Folk: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: "One piece? Now there's a hundred"

cards.name: Sea Monster
cards.text: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
cards.flavor: "Abandon ship"

cards.name: Seasoned Marshal
cards.text: Whenever Seasoned Marshal attacks, you may tap target creature.
cards.flavor: He reads the battlefield like a map, always seeking the shortest route to victory.

cards.name: Seeker of Skybreak
cards.text: {T}: Untap target creature.
cards.flavor: Seekers spend their lives protecting a home they rarely visit.

cards.name: Seismic Assault
cards.text: Discard a land card: Seismic Assault deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: Earth arms itself with fire.

cards.name: Serpent Warrior
cards.text: When Serpent Warrior enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
cards.flavor: They're the fiercest of all the Western Paladin's soldiers. They're also the most fiercely loyal—but that loyalty comes at a price.

cards.name: Serra Advocate
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: An angel's blessing prepares a soldier for war better than a thousand military drills.

cards.name: Serra Angel
cards.text:
Flying
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
cards.flavor: Her sword sings more beautifully than any choir.

cards.name: Serra's Embrace
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying and vigilance.
cards.flavor:
"With one breath, the newborn angel took to the air . . . and the world sighed."
—The Book of Serra

cards.name: Shanodin Dryads
cards.text: Forestwalk
cards.flavor: Where dryads dance, seeds sprout and flowers bloom.

cards.name: Shatter
cards.text: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Shield Wall
cards.text: Creatures you control get +0/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"If not for the wizard, we'd all be dead now. 'Course, it was him that started all this in the first place."
—Onean veteran

cards.name: Shivan Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The undisputed master of the mountains of Shiv.

cards.name: Shock
cards.text: Shock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Sisay's Ring
cards.text: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: "I'm not one for pretty things," said Sisay. "Unless they're pretty useful as well."

cards.name: Sky Diamond
cards.text:
Sky Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Skyshroud Falcon
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.flavor: The earliest mystics believed that the falcon slit the sky to let the light break through.

cards.name: Sleight of Hand
cards.text: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.
cards.flavor: "Most people believe magic is only a trick. Why change their minds?"

cards.name: Soul Feast
cards.text: Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.
cards.flavor: You are who you eat.

cards.name: Soul Net
cards.text: Whenever a creature dies, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Southern Paladin
cards.text: {W}{W}, {T}: Destroy target red permanent.
cards.flavor:
"How can anyone fight so much yet enjoy it so little?"
—The Western Paladin

cards.name: Spellbook
cards.text: You have no maximum hand size.
cards.flavor: Knowledge knows no bounds.

cards.name: Spined Wurm
cards.flavor:
"I wouldn't stand in front of that wurm, son. 'Course, I wouldn't stand behind it neither. In fact, standing anywhere near that wurm's not much of a plan. Running, now that's a plan"
—Wandering mage

cards.name: Spineless Thug
cards.text: Spineless Thug can't block.
cards.flavor: What it lacks in backbone, it makes up for in cruelty.

cards.name: Spirit Link
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.
cards.flavor: The noble paladins draw strength from the courage of others.

cards.name: Spitting Earth
cards.text: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
cards.flavor:
"We were ready for an attack from the front, sides, or back—but the mage hit us from below."
—Veteran soldier

cards.name: Squall
cards.text: Squall deals 2 damage to each creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"May the winds blow till they have wakened death. . . ."
—William Shakespeare,
Othello

cards.name: Standing Troops
cards.text: Vigilance
cards.flavor: They fight so closely together a mouse couldn't slip past their guard.

cards.name: Starlight
cards.text: You gain 3 life for each black creature target opponent controls.
cards.flavor:
"Even in the darkest night
Stars and angels still shine bright."
—Onean children's rhyme

cards.name: Static Orb
cards.text: As long as Static Orb is untapped, players can't untap more than two permanents during their untap steps.
cards.flavor: The warriors fought against the paralyzing waves until even their thoughts froze in place.

cards.name: Staunch Defenders
cards.text: When Staunch Defenders enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
cards.flavor:
"The key to winning any fight is simply staying alive."
—The Southern Paladin

cards.name: Steal Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
You control enchanted artifact.

cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.text: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Storm Cauldron
cards.text:
Each player may play an additional land during each of his or her turns.
Whenever a land is tapped for mana, return it to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Storm Crow
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor:
Storm crow descending, winter unending.
Storm crow departing, summer is starting.

cards.name: Storm Shaman
cards.text: {R}: Storm Shaman gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: She speaks with the voice of the winds, and the earth trembles.

cards.name: Strands of Night
cards.text: {B}{B}, Pay 2 life, Sacrifice a Swamp: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: When the strands call, only the dead answer.

cards.name: Stream of Life
cards.text: Target player gains X life.

cards.name: Stronghold Assassin
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target nonblack creature.
cards.flavor: The assassin sees only throats and hears only heartbeats.

cards.name: Sudden Impact
cards.text: Sudden Impact deals damage to target player equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.
cards.flavor: Caught red-handed.

cards.name: Sulfurous Springs
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool. Sulfurous Springs deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Sunweb
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
Sunweb can't block creatures with power 2 or less.
cards.flavor: Sometimes the wings of fallen dragons refuse to give up the sky.

cards.name: Sustainer of the Realm
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Sustainer of the Realm blocks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: You may break her shield, but you'll never break her spirit.

cards.name: Tainted Æther
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, its controller sacrifices a creature or land.
cards.flavor: Pockets of Æther can be so foul they melt flesh from bone.

cards.name: Teferi's Puzzle Box
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player puts the cards in his or her hand on the bottom of his or her library in any order, then draws that many cards.

cards.name: Telepathic Spies
cards.text: When Telepathic Spies enters the battlefield, look at target opponent's hand.
cards.flavor: Most spies sneak into enemy camps. These spies sneak into enemy minds.

cards.name: Telepathy
cards.text: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.
cards.flavor: "Secrets? What secrets?"

cards.name: Temporal Adept
cards.text: {U}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Of course she's at the head of her class. All of her classmates have disappeared."
—Tolarian renegade

cards.name: Thieving Magpie
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Thieving Magpie deals damage to an opponent, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Other birds collect twigs for their nests. Magpies steal jewels for theirs.

cards.name: Thorn Elemental
cards.text: You may have Thorn Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
cards.flavor: Rain from this storm leaves you pinned to the ground like an insect.

cards.name: Thoughtleech
cards.text: Whenever an Island an opponent controls becomes tapped, you may gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"Their thoughts flow through my mind, and I am healed."
—Fyndhorn elder

cards.name: Throne of Bone
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Tainted by a thousand fears.

cards.name: Tolarian Winds
cards.text: Discard all the cards in your hand, then draw that many cards.
cards.flavor:
Why not ask the winds?
—Tolarian expression meaning
"Who knows?"

cards.name: Trained Armodon
cards.flavor: Armodons are trained to step on things. Enemy things.

cards.name: Trained Orgg
cards.flavor:
"That arm's for bashin'. That one's for smashin'. That one's for scratchin'. And that one . . . I don't know what that one's for."
—Orgg trainer

cards.name: Tranquility
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments.

cards.name: Treasure Trove
cards.text: {2}{U}{U}: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Nope, there's nothing here either. You guys go on ahead, I'll catch up in a minute. . . . Whoo hoo"

cards.name: Treefolk Seedlings
cards.text: Treefolk Seedlings's toughness is equal to the number of Forests you control.
cards.flavor:
Even the grandest forest begins with a single seedling.
—Llanowar saying

cards.name: Tremor
cards.text: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
cards.flavor: Where do you run when the earth becomes your enemy?

cards.name: Twiddle
cards.text: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: Uktabi Wildcats
cards.text:
Uktabi Wildcats's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control.
{G}, Sacrifice a Forest: Regenerate Uktabi Wildcats.

cards.name: Underground River
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool. Underground River deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Unholy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
cards.flavor: "I don't feel any different."

cards.name: Unsummon
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Untamed Wilds
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: No forest is so remote that the elves don't know its secrets.

cards.name: Venerable Monk
cards.text: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: "I rely not so much on the wisdom of age as on the overconfidence of youth."

cards.name: Vengeance
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor:
"It is the duty of the strong to oppose any who threaten the weak."
—The Southern Paladin

cards.name: Verduran Enchantress
cards.text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: Each spell has its own song, and the enchantress knows the dance for each.

cards.name: Vernal Bloom
cards.text: Whenever a Forest is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
cards.flavor: Spring breathes the magic of new life.

cards.name: Vigilant Drake
cards.text:
Flying
{2}{U}: Untap Vigilant Drake.
cards.flavor: It can stay aloft for weeks with little or no sleep.

cards.name: Vizzerdrix
cards.flavor: A bored wizard once created a vizzerdrix out of a bunny and a piranha. He never made that mistake again.

cards.name: Volcanic Hammer
cards.text: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: Fire finds its form in the heat of the forge.

cards.name: Wall of Air
cards.text: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:
"Let the air itself protect you, for it is everywhere."
—Master wizard

cards.name: Wall of Bone
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor: A skeletal wall, strengthened by the souls of traitors, rings the city of the Eastern Paladin.

cards.name: Wall of Fire
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The erupting flames work as both barrier and weapon.

cards.name: Wall of Spears
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
First strike
cards.flavor:
"A stick is your friend. A pointed stick is your good friend. An army of pointed sticks is your best friend."
—Onean sergeant

cards.name: Wall of Swords
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
cards.flavor: Sharper than wind, lighter than air.

cards.name: Wall of Wonder
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{2}{U}{U}: Wall of Wonder gets +4/-4 until end of turn and can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender.
cards.flavor: They wondered at the size of it. It wondered which to eat first.

cards.name: Western Paladin
cards.text: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target white creature.
cards.flavor:
"Expect nothing but scorn, flattery, and lies. And never turn your back on him."
—The Northern Paladin

cards.name: Wild Growth
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
cards.flavor: If you stop to listen, you can hear it grow.

cards.name: Wildfire
cards.text: Each player sacrifices four lands. Wildfire deals 4 damage to each creature.
cards.flavor: Fire is always at the top of the food chain, and it has a big appetite.

cards.name: Wind Dancer
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The sky is her stage.

cards.name: Wind Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"But high she shoots through air and light,
Above all low delay,
Where nothing earthly bounds her flight,
Nor shadow dims her way."
—Thomas Moore,
"Oh that I had Wings"

cards.name: Wing Snare
cards.text: Destroy target creature with flying.
cards.flavor: The elves long ago mastered the art of hunting with nets. They call it "fishing the sky."

cards.name: Wood Elves
cards.text: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Every branch a crossroads, every vine a swift steed.

cards.name: Wooden Sphere
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Strengthened by a thousand limbs.

cards.name: Worship
cards.text: If you control a creature, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.
cards.flavor:
"Believe in the ideal, not the idol."
—Serra

cards.name: Wrath of God
cards.text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Yavimaya Enchantress
cards.text: Yavimaya Enchantress gets +1/+1 for each enchantment on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Her roots connect her to the forest's wishes.

cards.name: Yawgmoth's Edict
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a white spell, that player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: The warping of bodies and souls has become the heart of Yawgmoth's existence.
